transcript:
# XO Weekly Alignment

## Topics


## Transcript

[Anirudh Bhardwaj] (2025-10-28T15:31:08.607Z)
gone through the code, I don't think it is going to break a lot of things. So we'll probably see it. Hi Heather.

[UNKNOWN_SPEAKER] (2025-10-28T15:31:17.150Z)
What are we breaking?

[Anirudh Bhardwaj] (2025-10-28T15:31:19.030Z)
No, no, we are trying not to break anything.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:31:20.571Z)
I came in on the wrong end of that sentence.

[Anirudh Bhardwaj] (2025-10-28T15:31:25.192Z)
I'm just trying to get along with the engineers and ensure we don't break anything.

[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:31:32.935Z)
As long as we can see like, yes, this has been Yes, this is past or no, it's not past. Auto reject the ones that failed it, then we're good. Like requirements on my end are pretty simple.

[UNKNOWN_SPEAKER] (2025-10-28T15:31:48.032Z)
Yeah, straightforward.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:31:52.675Z)
Is it the code signal proctoring you're talking about?

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:31:57.679Z)
Long time coming.

[Anirudh Bhardwaj] (2025-10-28T15:31:59.560Z)
Alright, there it goes.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:32:04.032Z)
It still works out of the box, right? Am I wrong? Or we're still in the question phase? It does work outside the box, right? Or are we still at the question phase? Or I mean like on the code signal proctoring in terms of integration with the platform.

[Anirudh Bhardwaj] (2025-10-28T15:32:25.907Z)
Yeah, it works out of the box.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:32:30.879Z)
And you'll see that signal, whether it's proctored or not in the Cogsignal result.

[Anirudh Bhardwaj] (2025-10-28T15:32:36.782Z)
So the webhook events are different. But for the stages that are not started or started, so not started, we'll have to cancel and recreate. And started would not be impacted.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:32:51.831Z)
But whether it's proctored or not, you'll see that in the Cogsignal report, not in the platform.

[Anirudh Bhardwaj] (2025-10-28T15:32:57.614Z)
Yeah, in the report. I'll have to check on the platform, but the report for sure.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:33:06.081Z)
I'm not sure if Kevin agrees or is confused or what.

[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:33:14.105Z)
Leaving the technical decisions. Not technical, I'm just saying like expectations.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:33:19.348Z)
The cold signal report is the only place where we see whether it's proctored or not.

[UNKNOWN_SPEAKER] (2025-10-28T15:33:22.910Z)
Right now, yes.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:33:24.671Z)
And you're fine with that. For something more. I don't think we need more than that.

[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:33:29.756Z)
Well, no, I want to see it in Salesforce.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:33:38.421Z)
There's a time to talk and there's a time to not say anything. This is the time to talk. I'm going to manually go into Salesforce or into CodeSignal every time I have a candidate go to interview and then Your challenge is that you would have had both types of candidates at some point. You would have had some that went to the proctor, some that went to the non-proctor, and you basically want to make it clear when you look at the profile which version they took.

 Maybe that's another question. If you took the non-proctor, what happens?

[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:34:12.838Z)
Oh, yeah, I guess. I mean, if they have a pass score, yes. I might just cancel them all and have everybody retake who's taken it in the past. But yeah, right now, I mean, I can.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:34:35.851Z)
If you're doing that, then the work becomes retire the badge and create a new one and use the new one. But let's think about the pros and cons. Definitely, if you want to mix and match and keep some, keep them all, then, yeah. That's an important ITD. That's an ITD. It's, um, the con is rework for, um, Tons of rework with more or less the same exact test.

[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:35:05.983Z)
Same exact test. So if they passed it before, they should be able to pass it again. Uh, it's just, it's an extra hour and 10 minutes out of their life. It's just, um, well, we haven't, um, actually administer. I mean, it's not been on the pipeline in months. So maybe a retake isn't such a high ask.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:35:26.606Z)
I don't know how it was from point of view. Don't think about it. I'm just saying that there's a big difference. And if we're like, screw the old version, it's so tainted with cheating and whatnot that we don't know what to make out of it, then we do that. The old version, I don't know, even called it or whatever, retire it. It's no longer a patch. And we create a new one and there's no migration per se because just added to pipelines.



[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:35:57.587Z)
The alternative is anytime someone with an old score comes to the review queue, I have to manually cancel it, reach out to the candidate, tell them, Hey, you should retake this. And then I have to make a decision. Based on what country they're in. Usually that's the giveaway. I'd rather just automate all this.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:36:25.015Z)
Automate a decision or automate as in my first proposal, which was don't keep any results. Start from scratch.

[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:36:33.060Z)
Yeah, first proposal, which would be that they come in and everybody who comes to the review queue, it means that they've been proctored and that they've been or are going to be proctored, uh, or have passed. And I don't know, I don't know if haven't been proctored yet. We'll come to my queue. That's, that's another thing I guess I'm going to find out in real time.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:36:55.364Z)
So because the result didn't come through, no, I think not. Anyway, we'll see.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:37:00.488Z)
So the other thing you'll want to test is whether CodeSignal will still let them upload an old score. If they've taken it for another company. Because they do allow that. They do allow you to take your old test that you've taken for another hiring process and upload that score for ours. And so you may just want to check in with them and see if they're going to flag that as an unproctored or if they're actually just going to say, hey, you can't do that anymore.



[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:37:33.998Z)
If they see it as two distinct tests, so there's nothing to reuse, or if they see it as a test that has both versions and yeah. Yeah, good catch.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:37:43.094Z)
It doesn't happen often. It's a super edge case, but when it does happen, it comes in really weird. Like it doesn't look like a normal, it looks like a normal test result in Salesforce. But then if you go to open the score report, it doesn't look like our normal ones.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:37:59.168Z)
And another question will be on the retake. Normally there is a, they also have their own cool off period. I don't know if they'll enforce the cross non-proctored and proctored. I know some people would have taken the non-proctored one two, three months ago, and now they can't take the un-proctored one.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:38:22.139Z)
Yeah, I think that our preference would probably be to treat them.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:38:28.203Z)
Oh, actually, here's the... The context on these questions is the following. You enable proctoring for our test, but what if you disable proctoring for that test? And create another test that has proctoring, and we decide which one we use, which is our preferred option. And in that case, how will the call of period impact and then whatnot? I would prefer that, because then even in personal, you see them in different patches, different segments.

 It's cleaner. Let's see. I have one question.

[Anirudh Bhardwaj] (2025-10-28T15:39:07.413Z)
So just to be clear, for people who have already cleared the unproctored test, we would want them to go through the proctored test again, or not?

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:39:18.516Z)
I think that's an ITD that everyone needs to write. I don't have enough data. I don't know. For example, I don't know how often you encounter cheating.

[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:39:28.458Z)
It's not about data. It's about, well, it's pretty frequent.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:39:33.079Z)
For example, if you're like, 50% of the people that I sent to interview, I got back a hiring manager saying, didn't you see that they've cheated? That's, for example, even if not everybody cheated, the fact that the late stage people that you likely get again at the late stage have done that makes it a good enough reason to do that. There's not data in the sense of, sorry.

[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:40:00.126Z)
I was going to make an argument just and the amount of time it's gonna take me to do manual shit, but that's actually a good point. At the $30 an hour level in the countries where we tend to get candidates, Robert and some of the other SVPs were saying that it's almost 80% of the candidates that we're getting were cheating.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:40:22.189Z)
And if they automatically get to cross apply and skip it, then you have, made that an exponential problem rather than a pipeline problem. That becomes a system problem.

[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:40:38.382Z)
So we should make this a new application step.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:40:42.605Z)
Ask them to undo the change on the old test and create another new test from scratch that represents the Proctor version. And then we'll have two IDs. We'll create another application step that points to the new ID. The old ID will be renamed to something like obsolete, do not use, so that things are super clear. From all active pipelines and all things like that, admin work. And then, yeah, the new one will be the one being used across all pipelines.



[Anirudh Bhardwaj] (2025-10-28T15:41:08.781Z)
What should happen for the... OK, that will anyways be...

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:41:12.822Z)
There's no need now to cancel, retake, recreate, because it's a different step, like it doesn't matter. The only problem with people that are in the stage are now in the stage where they should be at least at the test, but they enter the stage before you are at the test, so the test is not going to be there. Because remember that the assessments are created when you enter the stage. If you add something then, it's not there.

 And I don't know how often that happens. I assume it's not a problem.

[Anirudh Bhardwaj] (2025-10-28T15:41:40.561Z)
We have 514 applications in the started stage, but the data is from 2022.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:41:45.084Z)
No, I'm not talking about the ISR state. I'm saying, can they reach the RWA stage? And that's where co-signals should be administered. If you're adding up to a pipeline, the badge right now, they will not be asked to take the test, because they got to enter the stage of RWA before that was a requirement. And that's not necessarily a problem per se, because maybe they've taken another test to compensate for that.

 It's just something to account for if you're removing and adding something, or however it is.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:42:16.516Z)
The other thing to account for is that we never, well, we should never. This should be codified. Never remove an assessment before we have added the replacement. The new one always gets added before the old one gets taken away. Otherwise, everybody skips over that stage and never sees either assessment.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:42:38.416Z)
So if you remove it, they don't see.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:42:43.298Z)
If you remove, so if there's one assessment at the SMQ stage and you remove that assessment, everybody Who's at smq automatically advances to frq. It doesn't matter if five minutes later you go add a new smq test So the new one always needs to be added before you take away the deprecated one.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:43:03.296Z)
Otherwise You lose candidates in that process and they advance artificially So you're saying that when you add an assessment to a stage people that are already in that stage are going to be added that application step Well, it was something that I thought it's not I'm pretty sure they will it If not, it at least holds it in that stage, and we can check it.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:43:24.580Z)
But if they advance to FRQ, we lose the oversight. I'm pretty sure it gets added, though.

[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:43:34.228Z)
So before we move on to important stuff, and this might be important.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:43:40.813Z)
This is still important.

[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:43:42.295Z)
Regarding the thing that, Jagosh, I forwarded to you, in order to the attachments I needed to download them. Is it strange that when I replied, all the attachments weren't attached?

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:44:02.981Z)
I think you forwarded, you didn't reply.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:44:05.821Z)
If you try hitting reply and seeing if they attach, or try forward and try the opposite.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:44:12.843Z)
Reply removes attachments, always has been the case.

[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:44:16.213Z)
Oh, OK. I'm a little nervous that I downloaded them.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:44:27.259Z)
Well, there's, I mean, tools you can run them through if you wanted.

[UNKNOWN_SPEAKER] (2025-10-28T15:44:31.021Z)
I don't think you should.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:44:34.383Z)
And if you download it through Chrome, Chrome checked them already, too.

[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:44:37.786Z)
I did, yeah.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:44:44.634Z)
No, they are images. They are nothing else. Cool, cool. But that sounds like a reverse. It's quite the opposite of what they wanted to make it look like, It does seem like that person is a victim, or it's a victim and a fraudster, and the person raising it is another fraudster.

[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:45:06.928Z)
Yeah, I think so. Is this a incident that should be reported to some other more formal channel. I remember we used to do those trainings, but I can't find them.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:45:18.982Z)
There is a security at crossover.com. It will go to Anka, basically. She's still working part-time for us on demand, not fixed hours. Based on work she has, she sends the security at Crossover, it goes to Anka. Normally the question is if we do some due diligence to figure out if we did something bad, which I still don't assume even by the last time something shitty happened I clicked the report because I felt like that was a lot of shit there didn't uncover it but at least we can I covered a lot of holes but this one I think it's it's really highly isolated some people are fighting and we are in the we're in their range okay so do nothing send it to security but I'll not do more than that I personally do not want to spend any time on that to me it's not at all obvious that I don't have any Until that conversation with the guy happens.

 I don't I think this is a hoax or uh Some people are telling their scores security at crossover.com I think so. Yes for compliance Hang on.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:46:22.681Z)
I have it in my inbox. Let me go search That's when we had the whole last incident I sent it uh Security is it Crossover or Trilogy?

[UNKNOWN_SPEAKER] (2025-10-28T15:46:36.824Z)
I don't know.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:46:38.946Z)
I'm sorry, I have a security at Trilogy.

[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:46:40.728Z)
Nope, I'll do that one instead.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:46:46.295Z)
Let's see if I have Crossover. I don't see anything for Crossover. Do we need to be aware of, or are we good?

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:47:09.879Z)
The short version is that somebody claimed to have been offered PCCat test. But based on the looks of it, it seems like not necessarily. It seems like some people are trying to settle some scores. One being a real fraudster and the other being a fraudster. We'll see. Let Javed talk with him, and then let's have a written document. We'll leave it there. Let's see. I don't know if you guys have this document, which I'll just share with you now.

 Heather, Kevin, you all remember the budget plan, took those goals, split them out into initiatives prioritizing to some extent and the way I and others are working on is that we're setting some targets on when certain things should be rolled out production whether we hit them or not that's a different story there's always a plan right the document is now in your chat When did you learn?

[UNKNOWN_SPEAKER] (2025-10-28T15:48:31.555Z)
So Q4, 25.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:48:31.855Z)
You remember the bug, right? Where the buttons are in the wrong places in my GPT. Same bug. Can't imagine it. Like, we click on it and then click something else. Can't imagine it. You're there, right?

[UNKNOWN_SPEAKER] (2025-10-28T15:48:47.887Z)
There we go.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:48:49.847Z)
Lots of patience. That's FYI, I don't think when reading it, you'll be very confused about some things. There are some decisions on how to mix and match them and whatnot, but still aiming for the same big goals we discussed previously. This week we'll insert a survey, the application experience. It's a one-question experience. It gets randomly popping out at candidates to ask one single question that will help us understand whether the brand effort is making any dent.

 I'm just mentioning that because it's important, because we are doing it now, because we need time to collect data. So I don't want to end the quarter and not have any data. But otherwise, I don't know. That can be reviewed for our sync. But for me, the important topics were AI grading, were video grading for the engaging story, recall AI rollout, and stage swap. And what else? Oh, I don't know. To some extent, although we all discussed, I think the insights that came from running a survey on the people that got the spotlight summaries email, that was also another topic to go through.



[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:50:10.543Z)
What's that all about, AI? What's that all about?

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:50:13.505Z)
Instead of having Read AI set up locally and set up your own web who can not have Read AI not know how to set it up and whatnot. We have our own bot that joins our calls. You don't have to set it up yourself. It was enabled, and it blew up in flames, right?

[Anirudh Bhardwaj] (2025-10-28T15:50:32.127Z)
So one of the configuration missed. It actually got enabled yesterday.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:50:36.508Z)
It blew up in flames, extinguished the fire, and sending the animal back on the front line.

[Anirudh Bhardwaj] (2025-10-28T15:50:45.673Z)
And we've got one completed. I'm waiting for more and ask for a feedback maybe later this week. OK, so it's worth it.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:50:53.727Z)
Worth knowing that, and please correct me because I didn't try the experience. I know the requirements. It has a sensible name, like Crossover Interview Assistant. Once you accept it, it sends a G-chat, not a G-chat, sorry, a message on the chat of the meeting saying, hey, I'm your Crossover Assistant. I'm going to record the interview, blah, blah, whatever. I don't know what it says. And it will get the message.

 Now, whether people accept it or not, hopefully they do. On the name, whether they keep it or not, hopefully it depends on the message. And that's all. In time, we can go further. We can, at some point, use this to, I don't know. We can, by the way, with recall.ai, we can stream the transcription as it comes. So in some distant future, when this becomes our MIP, we can use that live to do something.



[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:51:34.426Z)
We could do that with Google Meet already. It streams the transcript into a Google Doc live.

[UNKNOWN_SPEAKER] (2025-10-28T15:51:40.410Z)
It does.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:51:41.431Z)
It's crappy, but it does it.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:51:44.500Z)
I actually like it. Google, I think it's better than many.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:51:48.563Z)
I was going to say, the last time I looked at it, it did a terrible job at like understanding certain words and I had to like do a find and replace in it.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:51:57.850Z)
But yeah, anyway, the problem is different. We need to set, we need, in order to programmatically control Google Meet, we'll have to have admin access on the Google suite, which we'll never get. From IT and whatnot. So that's a simple way that we own and works with anybody. You don't have to be in our domain. I don't care if you're managed by our IT. You just have to accept what we call AI in the meeting, just like any bot.

 OK, so it's been rolled out to how many people? I think that, Anirudh, you're trying to do a gradual rollout once it goes.

[Anirudh Bhardwaj] (2025-10-28T15:52:32.328Z)
Anirudh SIVARAMAKRISHNAN THROUGH INTERPRETER Poor folks, it has been rolled out. One of them completed. One of them had a success full interview assistant entering the meeting. Five are scheduled for the next three days. I'll monitor and I think once I've got feedback from these four over the next...

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:52:48.823Z)
Once it works, enable it for all SMEs that had ASRs as interviewers but did not have a transcription. That's like plus number one. Once we like that, I don't know, maybe we even send it instead of every day to all users. There's a choice on a user, whether you use EDI or our assistant. People don't know about it, but yeah, you could change it. So I guess we'll, eventually we'll want to change all of them to that because we just have more control.



[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:53:18.119Z)
Will it allow us to, will it include timestamps? Or does it just do a transcript?

[Anirudh Bhardwaj] (2025-10-28T15:53:27.284Z)
Transcript and summary, both. It gives both. Basically the interview summary pieces The way it was integrated with Read.AI, it is integrated with recall as well. So nothing changes there.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:53:41.863Z)
If we're going to have streaming interviews at some point, I'd love to collect data on who joins interviews on time and who joins interviews late and by how many minutes.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:53:54.354Z)
I can also do that anyway now because you know when they start talking. It seems like you have some scores to settle.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:54:05.434Z)
I do not have scores to settle, but it would make me really happy to be able to give people score cards on their quality as an interviewer and let them know how they are helping or hurting their team meet their hiring goals.

[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:54:19.860Z)
The score is there.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:54:28.171Z)
settling is there.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:54:32.293Z)
It's more about...

[UNKNOWN_SPEAKER] (2025-10-28T15:54:35.574Z)
I would do it.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:54:36.995Z)
I have a lot of people who are convinced that... I have a lot of people that I have to convince that candidate experience actually matters and that candidates who consistently have a core experience with senior executives in this company form a very poor opinion of this company and the senior executives. And so there's some reputation management to be had, especially when they're hearing from the top, why can't you recruit these kinds of people?

 And I have to explain, you've created a reputation that does not attract those kinds of people.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:55:14.545Z)
So- How do you connect the dots to Zoom doing that? Data and candidate feedback and So it's not only Crossover or AlphaSax, now we are at, I don't know, JohnSax, and John is a hiring manager. And it's not only some very few named people you're saying that it went broader. There are a lot of names that are known out there in the world.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:55:41.287Z)
Well, and it's also about, I can help people avoid the negative repercussions by giving them data quickly and early and helping them flag. The other piece is there are some people who think they have great interviewers on their team screening people for them and who don't realize how much those people are actually harming their pipelines. So like the escalation emails help because they're able to see SLA breaches, but there are other pieces of data that harm the candidate experience that they're not able to have visibility into.

 And so they don't understand why candidates are frustrated by the time they talk to them, or they don't understand why candidates are like, no, convince me that I want this job. I'm not going to convince you to hire me. You convince me that I want to accept your offer. And they're very taken aback by that. And they don't understand why candidates are approaching a final interview that way. So it's more from that framing.



[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:56:36.259Z)
A quick question before we move to the next topic. Kevin, when Suchi replied that she had to schedule the interview, why did we send that email, like, is that, are we sending emails even when IT managers or interviewers are asking to reschedule because we are relying on the old data or are they rescheduling in weird ways outside the system?

[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:57:01.802Z)
It's based on Salesforce data. So she rescheduled wrong. So it's based on Salesforce data. Um, if she reschedules with them via email, uh, then it doesn't show up in our system anyway.

[Heather Lother] (2025-10-28T15:57:14.699Z)
If you just click the calendar event and reschedule, it doesn't show up in our system either. You have to go to XO Admin and click the Reschedule button for it to update in our system.

[Kevin Norchi] (2025-10-28T15:57:24.486Z)
Or I've offered to do it a million times for them as well.

[Dragos Nuta] (2025-10-28T15:57:28.469Z)
